text: Grevillea reptans, also known as the Tin Can Bay grevillea, is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to south east Queensland. The prostrate shrub typically grows to a height of and has long branches with non-glaucous angular ridges branchlets. It has simple linear leaves with a blade that is long and wide. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== reptans Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Taxa named by Robert Owen Makinson
title: Grevillea reptans
